article.title: Pathfinder Systems to Provide Aircrew Trainer Prototype
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Pathfinder Systems Incorporated, Arvada, Colorado, is being awarded a more than $6 million cost-plus-fixed-fee contract for a Phase III Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) project for the operational prototype Marine Common Aircrew Trainer (MCAT) prototype two. This SBIR Phase III project will implement a baseline configuration upgrade based on the previously delivered MCAT prototype one and will build upon previously demonstrated and delivered Phase II simulation technologies. The Naval Air Warfare Center Training Systems Division, Orlando, Florida, is the contracting activity.
